snippet.title: Tas drug legalisation backed by ex-judge
snippet.content: A former Tasmanian chief magistrate has backed a report which calls on the state to decriminalise illegal drugs and increase rehabilitation funding. Community Legal Centres Tasmania on Monday released a study advocating a health-based approach to tackle the state's "failing" war on drugs. It's been supported by ex-judge Michael Hill, who says low-range offenders will have better prospects of rehabilitation if they are kept out of the criminal justice system. (C) AAP 2017
